item.title: Mushed up crap apples all over pavement and road, 4th October
item.description:
Crap apples all across road and pavement causing slip hazard. Also attracting vermin. Tree is heavy with crap apples. People and cars being regularly hit by falling fruit. A ridiculous choice of tree to plant on a pavement. Regularly blocks drain that is under it. Residents themselves have to clear (as when road cleaners come, cars are parked there for the station).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beaumont Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New fly tipping on the pavement, 4th October
item.description:
There is new fly tipping on this location almost every day. Please can you confirm that the offence is being investigated and offender prosecuted.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woodberry Down Estate, Hackney, London

item.title: Series of serious pot holes all the way down Ellison Road DA15 8BL, 4th October
item.description:
There are a series of serious pot holes all the way down Ellison Road DA15 8BL. The whole road needs to be resurfaced.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 60, Ellison Road, Longlands, London

item.title: 23 Teignmouth Road, 4th October
item.description:
Stump was left after insurance removal in Teignmouth Road. It is becoming hazardous as it is obstructing the pavement and the parking space. It is also dangerous as accidents have nearly happened on a couple of occasions when pulling out of drives as the view of oncoming cars and cyclists is obstructed. The tree was cut down to stump 9th May 2025. Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Teignmouth Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unauthorized and Illegal works to TPO Species tree at 43 Copers Cope Rd BR3 1NJ, 4th October
item.description:
The historic tree at April Court in the front garden by Copers Cope Road is very tall, about 200 years old, and protected by law via a TPO. I attach photos of construction works going on now, which are not permitted under the Council's planning permission of 2022 for improvements. The works to create new parking spaces infringe to RPA (root protection zones) of this fine tree. The photos illustrate this beyond doubt. If you do not stop these works, you risk damaging the tree, perhaps fatally. The RPA for a protected TPO tree of this size , spread and height would be at least six metres radius from the trunk. These photographs are evidence of the most extreme negligence. Please stop these works immediately"!!! My phone number 0791 861 1959. R Coonan. 25 Monivea Rd BR3 1HJ

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Copers Cope Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedges affecting pavement walkway, 4th October
item.description:
This is on the corner of the road which leads to Elmer’s end station. It’s part of the country park and if there are two people passing it’s difficult to not be pushed into the road as the hedge is very overgrown. Also the cars coming out of the football building can’t see past it for turning. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 257, Elmers End Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
